report.summary: On emulator, search results crashes when there's one result
report.label: Bug
report.description: On either landscape, or portrait, due to a NullPointerException somewhere inside TabWidget. Works fine on devices.

report.summary: Shortcut can be lost on screen flip
report.label: Bug
report.description: On some versions, if you flip the screen during the "Creating Shortcut..." phase of the shortcut creation process, the shortcut doesn't get made. Small screen - 2.0 Regular screen - 1.5 This can be demonstrated reliably on a Samsung Moment running 1.5.

report.summary: Move the first-time screen to the tab activity
report.label: Bug
report.description: Instead of the people activity.

report.summary: Don't show website item on profile if there is no URL
report.label: Bug
report.description: As it stands right now, you'll try to touch it and then it'll crash.

report.summary: Large image getting selected when medium is asked for
report.label: Bug
report.description: Al Franken's medium image has no white border: http://assets.sunlightfoundation.com/moc/100x125/F000457.jpg His large image does: http://assets.sunlightfoundation.com/moc/200x250/F000457.jpg When you first ask for his image on the list, for the medium image, it has no border. Loading his profile loads the large image, with a border. Future requests for his medium image (sponsorship, listing) loads the large one, with a border. Why?

report.summary: Handling out of office legislators
report.label: Bug
report.description: Specify all_legislators=true on the call in LegislatorService.

report.summary: Sponsored Bills screen doesn't say when there are none
report.label: Bug
report.description: It just spins forever. Example (as of right now): Scott Brown has sponsored no bills.

report.summary: Bug on RollInfo regarding databases
report.label: Bug
report.description: I must have done something wrong, this report rolled in from a Droid running v2.6 of the app: java.lang.IllegalStateException: attempt to acquire a reference on a close SQLiteClosable at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteClosable.acquireReference(SQLiteClosable.java:31) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteQuery.fillWindow(SQLiteQuery.java:69) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.fillWindow(SQLiteCursor.java:288) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount(SQLiteCursor.java:269) at com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.RollInfo.displayVoters(RollInfo.java:170) at com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.RollInfo.onLoadRoll(RollInfo.java:118) at com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.RollInfo$LoadRollTask.onPostExecute(RollInfo.java:295) at com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.RollInfo$LoadRollTask.onPostExecute(RollInfo.java:1) at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:417) at android.os.AsyncTask.access$300(AsyncTask.java:127) at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:429) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4363) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java:-2) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:521) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:860) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:618) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java:-2)

report.summary: Cancel all AsyncTasks in onDestroy
report.label: Bug
report.description: Two problems should be fixed: User taps a bill name, is brought to BillLoader, user hits back, a few seconds later they are taken to the bill anyway. User taps a vote name in the Votes tab for a bill, immediately hits back, a Force Close error appears.

report.summary: Fix Thomas permalinks
report.label: Bug
report.description: Use THOMAS' handle specification: http://thomas.loc.gov/home/handles/help.html

report.summary: Handle RejectedExecutionException in activities where you can expect to generate many AsyncTasks
report.label: Bug
report.description: Basically, anything with photos, so probably just LegislatorList and RollInfo. Recent stack trace: java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException: at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$AbortPolicy.rejectedExecution(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1876) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.reject(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:774) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.execute(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1295) at android.os.AsyncTask.execute(AsyncTask.java:394) at com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.LegislatorList.loadPhoto(LegislatorList.java:182) at com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.LegislatorList$LegislatorAdapter.getView(LegislatorList.java:303) at android.widget.AbsListView.obtainView(AbsListView.java:1256) at android.widget.ListView.makeAndAddView(ListView.java:1668) at android.widget.ListView.fillDown(ListView.java:637) at android.widget.ListView.fillGap(ListView.java:608) at android.widget.AbsListView.trackMotionScroll(AbsListView.java:2531) at android.widget.AbsListView$FlingRunnable.run(AbsListView.java:2353) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4363) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java:-2) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:521) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:860) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:618) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java:-2)

report.summary: Mistake on congress_office regexp
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some of them still have an "Office" or "Building" trailing.

report.summary: Notifications were being checked every minute for some reason
report.label: Bug
report.description: This was a severe battery drain, and it's not at all clear why it was happening. I'll try to replicate. Two possibilities: the recurring alarm was set to happen every minute, or, the recurring alarm got set multiple times and the offset between them was a minute.

report.summary: Stop the phone from turning on Wifi
report.label: Bug
report.description: Running the notification service sometimes causes my phone to turn on Wifi even when I have it explicitly disabled. This shouldn't happen.

report.summary: RollList and BillList aren't handling pagination correctly
report.label: Bug
report.description: Both depend on there being some content for their source, which is not always going to be correct. Refactor it so that it separates a not-yet-fetched array (null) from an empty array. Take advantage of Real Time Congress' superior pagination metadata.

report.summary: Change inner AsyncTask classes to be static
report.label: Bug
report.description: So that they don't keep an implicit reference to their original enclosing Activity instance upon screen flip. This may be moot now that we handle screen flips by storing data in fragments.

report.summary: Parsing exception when lat/long or zip not valid
report.label: Bug
report.description: Make sure that if the Sunlight API does throw an exception and return a string message (like if the lat/long or zip code isn't in America), that it fails gracefully and not with a JSON parsing exception. java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground() at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:200) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerSetException(FutureTask.java:273) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:124) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:307) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1068) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:561) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1096) Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: org.json.JSONException: A JSONObject text must begin with '{' at character 1 of

report.summary: New Laws notification duplicates
report.label: Bug
report.description: I get notified over and over about "6 new bills signed into law". I haven't yet managed to scoop the logcat in time where it shows what the lastSeenId is, but I need to figure out why this notification in particular is notifying me over and over. It's not notifying me on every cycle - just more than it should, and when I get taken to the list, there aren't any new items. Very troublesome.

report.summary: Add "daily" option to notification intervals
report.label: Bug
report.description: By request, and it makes a lot of sense.

report.summary: In "News" tab for bills, distinguish between "No news" and "Error while getting news"
report.label: Bug
report.description: I'm trying to work on issue 335, but it's difficult because I'm not getting any news results for any bills. LogCat shows that there is some error fetching the data from the Google News API*, but to a user, it would just look like there wasn't any news (which is reasonable for most bills, really). I think there's already an alert function in Utils, we just need to make sure it gets called. * It turns out this is because I hadn't put in a Google News API key. The documentation said the API key wasn't absolutely necessary, but it didn't seem to be happy about giving me results if I didn't have one.

report.summary: Proper pagination
report.label: Bug
report.description: Make use of a ListView's footer view slot for the "Loading..." item in a paginated list. To spawn off requests for the next page, use the logic of whether the item showing is the last position in the list.

report.label: Bug
report.description: Did I rename some receivers without thinking? java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to instantiate receiver com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.notifications.OnBootReceiver: java.lang.InstantiationException: com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.notifications.OnBootReceiver at android.app.ActivityThread.handleReceiver(ActivityThread.java:2913) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$3200(ActivityThread.java:135) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:2198) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:144) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4937) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:521) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:868) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:626) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.InstantiationException: com.sunlightlabs.android.congress.notifications.OnBootReceiver at java.lang.Class.newInstanceImpl(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:1429) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleReceiver(ActivityThread.java:2904) ... 10 more

report.summary: Handle a locked DB in the footer gracefully
report.label: Bug
report.description: Before trying to update a user's subscription, check to see if the DB is locked. If it is, toast the user with a message like "Currently processing other subscriptions. Try again in a few seconds.", and don't change the message or state of the footer (or change it back to what it was). In setWorking(), store a lastState variable with the state the footer was in, and add a method to the footer that handles exceptions by reverting back to the lastState, and does the toast.

report.summary: YouTube video dates are wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: It displays dates out of order on the list, and sometimes when videos are updated they cause notifications.

report.summary: Ensure legislator list for location search automatically scans for location upon load
report.label: Bug
report.description: Now that we scrapped the location code from the menus.

report.summary: Paginated lists will crash when less than a full page of results comes down
report.label: Bug
report.description: Test out with Rep. Aderholt's sponsored bills.

report.summary: NullPointerException in Bill.thomasType
report.label: Bug

report.summary: On migration, fix duplicate subscription rows
report.label: Bug
report.description: Basically, on migration: Add a method Database.removeSubscription(subscription, true) which is like removeSubscription(subscription), but only removes rows where seen_id is null for each seen_id-less subscription -- Database.getSubscriptions() remove just the seen_id-less rows -- Database.removeSubscription(subscription, true) add 1 seen_id-less row back for it -- Database.addSubscription(subscription) This is only needed to a fix a bug where the notification checker has been filling up people's database with useless seen_id-less rows for their subscriptions. Besides being needed for a new feature, this will also lessen the data footprint the app takes up on people's phones.

report.summary: CommitteeList breaks on screen flip
report.label: Bug
report.description: It reloads from the net after each flip, and then doesn't update with the new results.

report.summary: Tracker won't mark main menu if changelog appears
report.label: Bug
report.description: It'll call track(activity, null) first, to generate the fragment, then not mark the page on the next call to track(). Not sure how best to fix this, or if it needs fixing (as we'll only lose the first open after update), but it's worth addressing if we can.

report.summary: Legislator photos need a reload to appear
report.label: Bug
report.description: It's been happening for a long time, not sure when it got introduced.

report.summary: Aggregate floor updates under timestamps
report.label: Bug
report.description: Only show a timestamp when it's new, like dates.

report.summary: Notification for floor updates goes to wrong activity
report.label: Bug
report.description: Goes to the list, not the tabs.

report.summary: Reorder news items client-side after fetching
report.label: Bug
report.description: It's a little disorienting in its current state. Further, if coming in from a notification: Highlight new items Float to the top (disobey ordering)

report.summary: String exception when comparing votes
report.label: Bug
report.description: Rolled in: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException at java.lang.String.charAt(String.java:643) at org.json.JSONObject.accumulate(JSONObject.java:290) at com.sunlightlabs.congress.models.Roll$Vote.compareTo(Roll.java:62) at com.sunlightlabs.congress.models.Roll$Vote.compareTo(Roll.java:1)

report.summary: Bill searches should go right to only result
report.label: Bug
report.description: Not sure why it doesn't right now.

report.summary: Update FragmentUtils to use fragment's view, not activity's
report.label: Bug
report.description: It should always just work.

report.summary: Update Calendar integration to use ICS' proper tools
report.label: Bug
report.description: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/CalendarContract.html The current way appears to work fine on ICS on my Galaxy Nexus, but it remains an undocumented API. The above method is a documented API, but only works in ICS and up.

report.summary: Footer doesn't update when returning from enabling notifications
report.label: Bug
report.description: This used to work before all the fragmentization refactoring from last version.

report.summary: Obscure TextView bug on date of sticky header on FloorUpdateFragment
report.label: Bug
report.description: Scroll immediately down to loading view, then scroll back up - the meridian will disappear for all AM times on the header from then on. Incredibly weird.

report.summary: Move context menu into touch menu in action bar
report.label: Bug
report.description: Go towards a more dynamic action bar, removing context menu and rolling my own touch menu. Not yet willing to use that 3rd party action bar replacement.

report.summary: Make sure new styling and rules work on Honeycomb
report.label: Bug
report.description: I think some of the values in values-11 may need to move to a values-14.

report.summary: Try out on Nexus S with ICS
report.label: Bug
report.description: To make sure.

report.summary: First time, Changelog, Notification dialogs on ICS
report.label: Bug
report.description: These should all get a visual inspection to make sure they don't look janky on ICS.

report.summary: Remove query string values from all analytics URLs
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you feel you must send in the bill ID, or the person ID, send an additional custom event.

report.summary: Move the 'entry' custom variable to an event
report.label: Bug
report.description: This may give me a more accurate idea of how often this is occurring.

report.summary: Have Up button go just one level up
report.label: Bug
report.description: Not always to the root.

report.summary: Display favorite bills in a consistent manner to BillList
report.label: Bug
report.description: Shouldn't look so different.

report.summary: Turn the top simple header color to the date color
report.label: Bug
report.description: A slightly lighter grey, so it doesn't blend in with the title bar.

report.summary: Tweets are not loading
report.label: Bug
report.description: That's a dealbreaker!

report.summary: Labels for global search
report.label: Bug
report.description: People actually use that, apparently. Label them appropriately in the settings list.

report.summary: Put bill shortcuts back in
report.label: Bug
report.description: Unlike legislator shortcuts, this is trivial, and being asked for.

report.summary: Make gingerbread-specific notification icon
report.label: Bug
report.description: Especially now that 2/3 of my app's visits are from Gingerbread users, having a notification icon specifically for 2.3.x (res/drawable-X-v9) makes sense.

report.summary: Remove session scoping on bill relevance results
report.label: Bug
report.description: That is ridiculous, why did I do that?

report.summary: Update Google Analytics SDK for Android
report.label: Bug
report.description: We're on 1.1 - several releases have occurred since then. The current version is 1.4.2. Use setAnonymizeIP() to anonymize IPs. Figure out whether we should set a sample rate: http://code.google.com/apis/analytics/docs/mobile/android.html#sampleRate http://code.google.com/apis/analytics/docs/concepts/gaConceptsSampling.html

report.summary: Check for whether alarm is still set when app is opened
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just in case, there've been multiple reports over the last year or so of people losing their notifications, fixed by disabling and re-enabling. This is only worth it if there's a way to check for the alarm being actually set, not just looking at some shared pref. For all I know, the alarm is being killed with no warning or callback to disable such a shared pref flag.

report.summary: Test out large fonts for accessibility
report.label: Bug
report.description: Not sure how best to test this out, but I got a user report, and it makes sense.

report.summary: Move RTC endpoint back into config file
report.label: Bug
report.description: To minimize chances of the staging URL accidentally getting committed.

report.summary: Census of Market errors
report.label: Bug
report.description: There are 5, as of right now, small one-off errors that have not been repeated - but take a look anyway.

report.summary: Up button should do Back where appropriate
report.label: Bug
report.description: If the user's coming in from a search or something, the Up button should just go back. There are ways to do this.

report.summary: Update KML map URLs with cache-buster
report.label: Bug
report.description: By the day, so that it can be cached for at least a day. Add the date to the end of the URL.

report.summary: hcres/scres should work in code detector
report.label: Bug
report.description: And be translated to hconres and sconres.

report.summary: UTF-8 problem with accented names
report.label: Bug
report.description: Jose Serrano's name is messed up. Appears to be coming off the API fine.

report.summary: Don't show youtube tab for out-of-office people
report.label: Bug
report.description: They're done.

report.summary: Restore cosponsors number and button
report.label: Bug
report.description: Geez. It's missing now - this means restoring cosponsors_count too, I think.

report.summary: Fix cosponsors count and missing button
report.label: Bug
report.description: We dropped the cosponsors button! This needs to come back.

report.summary: Explicitly order floor updates
report.label: Bug
report.description: Apparently it's depending on insertion order, which is bad news.

report.summary: Fetching a bill's votes throws an error
report.label: Bug
report.description: No notifications for them.

report.summary: Upcoming display bug on mdpi devices
report.label: Bug
report.description: Probably just a fixed height? Seems rare enough.

report.summary: Order upcoming bills secondarily on range
report.label: Bug
report.description: To prevent situations like this:

report.summary: Do another pass on improving news searches
report.label: Bug
report.description: S. 114 is, for some reason, particularly afflicted by only football results - the bill has nothing to do with that.

report.summary: Handle missing office numbers more gracefully
report.label: Bug
report.description: Don't crash if it's missing. Got a NullPointerException when one was for a bit.

report.summary: Search query, highlight bugs
report.label: Bug
report.description: It says "null" matches the field. Also, when I searched for "border security", the highlighted word was only "security", leading me to believe the request being made is incorrect. I suspect that I need to quote the search term - this is a new requirement as of the Congress API, and I probably didn't adjust it when switching from RTC.

report.summary: Error message for missing vote should acknowledge that vote may not be posted yet
report.label: Bug
report.description: Especially when linking from floor updates, which auto-link to votes more quickly than they are posted.

report.summary: Improve locating process
report.label: Bug
report.description: Display message during locating process Fall back to network location after not very long Currently, if the app struggles to locate someone through GPS, it just runs the spinner with no message, indefinitely.

report.summary: Jackson parser doesn't work in Android 2.2
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is used to parse GeoJSON for district maps. The normal JSON parser is obviously fine, but the GeoJSON object mapper requires Jackson. 2.2 isn't a very large % of our users, just a few %. But instead of ditching Android 2.2 just yet, I'm inclined to just disable maps for Android 2.2, with a message. It is still an improvement on the broken, ugly situation they were in previously, and the alternative is to do my own native GeoJSON parsing, or to drop 2.2 altogether.

report.summary: Voting and bills per-legislator subscriptions still point to removed activities
report.label: Bug
report.description: They are written as strings, and so didn't get flagged by Eclipse during the delete. Any existing notifications for new bills or votes by one's member of Congress will cause a crash. Change this so that the notifications now point to the LegislatorPager and get defaulted to the correct tab. The BillPager already does an identical thing for some per-bill notifications.

report.summary: Expand hearing window so ongoing hearings appear
report.label: Bug
report.description: By 2 or 3 hours, so people in hearings don't lose the hearing's data at the stroke of whenever the hearing starts. Easy, ship this in the next version.

report.summary: Upcoming should explicitly filter on bill times
report.label: Bug
report.description: So that we can remove the special case for upcoming bills in the API.

report.summary: "Coming Up" bill detail can show very long list of activity
report.label: Bug
report.description: Per feedback from a user, this list can be long and annoying. Consider adding a way to limit the number of items that show up on a summary page.

report.summary: Fix URLs to Sunlight/GovTrack/OC/Bioguide
report.label: Bug
report.description: They're out of date and use plain HTTP.

report.summary: Showing bill votes as failing when they are pasing
report.label: Bug
report.description: [H.R. 3364 passed both houses](https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/3364, but a user sent this in: Should fix this post-haste.
